intro: Sessea lehmannii, commonly known as the Lehmann's sesse, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in shrubland and coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
